rComments: I loved the class I took with Prof. Mehta last year, so I took my ENG 400 seminar with her - she is fantastic. She's constructive and knowledgable during discussions but lets you form educational bonds with your peers and isn't overbearing. I couldn't recommend this course, or any course, with her enough. SHe's a shining star at U of T.
teacherRatingTags: ['Caring', 'Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: She is a very nice lady who provides helpful advice if you come to her office hours. Make sure you read the assignment prompts carefully. She is more forgiving with your first assignment, but the way she marks the second paper depends on whether you interpreted the prompt correctly and ignored or listened to her suggestions/criticism/comments.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Professor Mehta is a really knowledgeable and caring professor. The readings were rather light and varied between novel, short story, art, film, etc. Her way of considering participation was awesome -- she collected comment cards the end of each class for those too shy to speak. Work was graded fairly and her expecations were always really clear.

Professor Mehta is a truly incredible lecturer and professor. You can tell how passionate she is about what she teaches, her lectures are well-organized and easy to follow along with, while being content heavy. You'll really learn a lot that sticks with you if you take her class(es), and she is so approachable and helpful.

Prof. Mehta is a diamond in the rough. I am so grateful I got to take PoCo lit with her - she clearly constructs her class as to not create an excessive academic burden on students, and considers and implements their feedback. I felt like being in her class was a reciprocal arrangement of respect, understanding, and learning - she rocks.

One of the clearest, most organized lecturers I've had. She definitely expects a lot of students' assignments, both in terms of quality of ideas and quality of writing, but she's also very understanding, lenient, and willing to help. I'd give her more than five stars if I could!
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Participation matters', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I took two courses with Professor Mehta and I thoroughly enjoyed both of them! Her interests in South Asian colonialism and literature really shone through her lectures. She really does go in-depth when asked specific questions and gives clear lectures. She encourages the students to discuss (even though a lot of us were reluctant to talk).
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: One of the best professors I've ever had. She gave thorough feedback on assignments, was always available during class, office hours, and through e-mail, and her grading criteria was well-structured. Her lectures were incredible and her index card plan made it easy to do well in participation. Our readings were also amazing. Take a course with her!
